deliverable_registry.name: Onboarding Handshake
deliverable_registry.description: Initial alignment echo including principles and role acceptance.

deliverable_registry.name: Environment Manifest
deliverable_registry.description: Telemetry of hardware and software prerequisites.
deliverable_registry.purpose: Ensures environment parity for multi-threaded execution.

deliverable_registry.name: Structural Mapping
deliverable_registry.description: Echo of functional domains and logic boundaries.
deliverable_registry.purpose: Bridges the gap between process awareness and product awareness.

deliverable_registry.name: Proficiency Certification
deliverable_registry.description: Evidence of successful GSD cycle execution on non-logic artifacts.

deliverable_registry.name: Integrity Snapshot
deliverable_registry.description: Cryptographic signature and binary baseline of all protocols.
deliverable_registry.purpose: Ground truth for regression detection and restoration.

deliverable_registry.name: Fidelity Audit
deliverable_registry.description: Side-by-side granular diff of protocol modifications.

deliverable_registry.name: Error Trace
deliverable_registry.description: Captured stack trace or syntax error location.
deliverable_registry.purpose: Identifies root cause for emergency recovery.

deliverable_registry.name: Implementation Plan
deliverable_registry.description: Strategic technical proposal for logic changes.

deliverable_registry.name: Recovery Patch
deliverable_registry.description: Unified Diff persisted as a recoverable file.
deliverable_registry.purpose: Provides rollback capability and audit trail.

deliverable_registry.name: Post-Implementation Review
deliverable_registry.description: Synthesis of product outcome and process performance.

deliverable_registry.name: Protocol Compliance Audit
deliverable_registry.description: Self-audit of adherence to pulses and snapshots, including friction analysis.
deliverable_registry.purpose: Ensures process rigor and identifies governance bottlenecks.

deliverable_registry.name: Status Report
deliverable_registry.description: Synthesized JSON report of health and debt.

deliverable_registry.name: README Document
deliverable_registry.description: Compiled Markdown summary of the project state.

deliverable_registry.name: Protocols Library
deliverable_registry.description: Compiled Markdown manual of all system rules.

compliance_registry.name: Knowledge Refresh Pulse
compliance_registry.constraint: Mandatory execution of onboard.js --refresh at turn start.
compliance_registry.verification: Evidence of version synchronization in GSD Phase 1.

compliance_registry.name: Baseline Integrity Snapshot
compliance_registry.constraint: Capture of bit-perfect protocol hashes at Phase 1 start.
compliance_registry.verification: Existence of DLR_VFY_SNAPSHOT matching session start timestamp.

compliance_registry.name: Fidelity Audit Execution
compliance_registry.constraint: Validation of structural and semantic protocol integrity.
compliance_registry.verification: Pass signal from DLR_VFY_AUDIT before finalization.

compliance_registry.name: Referential Link Audit
compliance_registry.constraint: Zero broken or orphaned DLR_ and CMP_ identifiers.

compliance_registry.name: Sequential Phase Adherence
compliance_registry.verification: Audit trail showing sequential transition through all 5 phases.

compliance_registry.name: Friction Awareness Disclosure
compliance_registry.verification: Inclusion of Friction Score and Analysis in DLR_PIR_COMPLIANCE.

ONBOARD_V3.philosophy: Collaborative Stewardship: Aligning Director vision with Engineer execution from Turn 1.
principles: Director owns Objective & Decision; Engineer owns Execution & Verification.
Integrity of the codebase is maintained through strict protocol adherence.
Transparency is achieved through mandatory initial response echoes.

responsibilities: Integrity of the codebase and protocol adherence.
Protocol Stewardship: Proposing workflow improvements via EVO_V1.
Defining project vision and success criteria.
Validation of telemetry and environmental state.
Providing the authoritative source of truth for code/data.
Final approval of all documentation and architectural pivots.

data_standard.requirement: Read protocols.json to establish role definitions.

onboarding_standard.deliverable: [DLR_ONB_HANDSHAKE]: Core Principles Echo: Confirm alignment with project philosophy.
[DLR_ONB_HANDSHAKE]: Role Acknowledgment: Accept accountability for Engineer/Director roles.
[DLR_ONB_HANDSHAKE]: Registry Index Mapping: Verify understanding of all active protocols.
[DLR_ONB_HANDSHAKE]: Dependency Map Confirmation: Confirm baseline environment and file paths.

proficiency_standard.requirement: Entity status set to 'Pending Engineer' until completion of [DLR_PRY_CERT].

scope_standard.requirement: Engineer acknowledges GSD_V3 as the primary operational loop.

operational_workflow.description: Read and echo core_principles to establish shared values.
Acknowledge expanded role definitions and accountabilities.
Map and confirm all internal dependencies and registry_index.
steps: Map (GSD, CFG, VAL, DOC, EVO, STAT, OPTIMISE)

operational_workflow.description: Perform a 'No-Op' baseline check if environment parity is in question.

ENV_V1.philosophy: Stability is Physical: Logic requires a verified environment to execute with fidelity.
principles: Infrastructure as Requirement: Hardware and software prerequisites are part of the codebase.
Resource Accountability: Threads, memory, and CPU allocation must be verified.
Zero-Friction Setup: Environment validation must be automated for zero-knowledge entry.

environment_standard.requirement: Verify Node.js >= 20.x, NPM tree integrity, and OS compatibility.
Validate CPU core count >= 4 for multi-threaded operation.

operational_workflow.description: Engineer validates physical and logical resource availability.
steps: Detect physical CPU cores and available memory.
Verify presence of required build tools (if applicable).

MAP_V1.philosophy: Context precedes Logic: An entity cannot modify what it does not map.
principles: Discovery First: Mapping of functional domains is a prerequisite for logic injection.
Modular Abstraction: Protocols define the method of discovery; manifests define the product content.
Boundary Awareness: Clear identification of interfaces prevents unintended side effects.

data_standard.requirement: Locate and ingest the project-specific system manifest (e.g., status_metadata.json).

mapping_standard.requirement: Identify and echo Functional Domains, Boundary Interfaces, and Support Utilities.
Re-map system architecture to ensure context parity with new structural state.

operational_workflow.description: Engineer identifies the authoritative source of product architecture metadata.
Engineer extracts the structural map of the product.
Engineer provides a project-agnostic structural summary to the Director.
operational_workflow.gate: Director ratifies the [DLR_MAP_STRUCT] and authorizes GSD_V3 Phase 1.

principles: Low-Risk Entry: Initial procedural mastery is proven on non-logic artifacts.
Toolchain Verification: Successful use of GSD, patches, and integrity tools is a prerequisite for logic access.
Knowledge Recalibration: Mastery of the Protocol Library state is verified during the pulse.

proficiency_standard.requirement: Execute one full GSD_V3 cycle on a Non-Logic Artifact (e.g., metadata, documentation).
Director defines specific Mode (Meta-Update, Protocol Tweak, or No-Op Verification).
Director determines if the change is Retained or Reverted via VFY_V1 --restore.

certification_standard.requirement: Director grants full 'Engineer' designation; baseline logic access unlocked.

operational_workflow.description: Director assigns a low-risk, non-logic task to the Pending Engineer.
steps: Define intended outcome and persistence mode.

operational_workflow.description: Pending Engineer executes the task following strict GSD_V3 protocols.
Director reviews the cycle and promotes the entity to Engineer.
operational_workflow.gate: Director issues 'Certified' command [DLR_PRY_CERT] to unlock GSD_V3 logic injection.

VFY_V1.philosophy: Trust but Verify: Governance is only as strong as its audit trail.
principles: Fidelity First: Semantic meaning and structural precision must be preserved across updates.
Automated Audit: Integrity checks are mandated as a pre-requisite for finalization.
Evidence-Based: Deliverables must satisfy constraints with high confidence.

data_standard.requirement: Maintain [DLR_VFY_SNAPSHOT] as the verified baseline map.

confidence_standard.requirement: Engineer must assign a Confidence Score (0.0-1.0) to major deliverables (Plans, Reviews) based on evidence reliability.

operational_workflow.description: Engineer captures the state of the protocol library before modification.
steps: Verify all active protocols are hashed in [DLR_VFY_SNAPSHOT].

operational_workflow.description: Engineer validates that modifications have not introduced regressions.

FIX_V1.philosophy: Urgency is no Excuse for Instability: Hotfixes require stricter rigor than features.
principles: Stop the Line: Execution ceases immediately upon detection of environmental regression.
Verified Healing: No recovery without a corresponding integrity verification.
Isolation: Recovery tasks are atomic and must not include 'feature creep'.

recovery_standard.requirement: Perform bit-perfect restoration via write_file or VFY_V1 --restore.
Execute ENV_V1 to re-verify prerequisites before re-onboarding.

guardrail_standard.requirement: No logic bypass allowed; all fixes must produce [DLR_GSD_PATCH].

operational_workflow.description: Engineer identifies the specific root cause of the regression.
Engineer applies the minimal necessary change to restore stability.
steps: Apply the fix following GSD Phase 3.

operational_workflow.description: Engineer confirms the environment is once again stable.
steps: Execute tools/onboard.js --refresh to confirm toolchain health.

GSD_V3.philosophy: Integrity over Velocity: Verified implementation precedes execution.
principles: All logic changes must produce a recoverable patch file.
No logic changes without a corresponding test.
Mandatory Director approval at key gates.

data_standard.requirement: Identify relevant files and read content.
Update [DLR_STAT_REPORT] and [DLR_DOC_README] to reflect new system state.

operational_standard.guardrail: Every injection requires a [DLR_GSD_PATCH] and PPIC (Visual Audit).
Debug loops are capped at 3 attempts before rollback.
Mandatory Director approval at key gates.

operational_workflow.description: Engineer autonomously establishes baseline and identifies logic failure points.
steps: Perform Knowledge Pulse: Verify and Echo active protocol baseline versions.
Identify relevant files and read content.
Echo active logic or problem scope to Director.
operational_workflow.gate: Director acknowledges context and authorizes Planning phase.

operational_workflow.description: Engineer proposes a logic plan. Execution pauses for approval.
steps: Analyze gap between Baseline and Objective.
operational_workflow.gate: Execution STOPS until Director Ratifies the Plan.

operational_workflow.description: Engineer applies changes with transparency and syntax validation.
steps: Display Unified Diff of proposed changes.
operational_workflow.gate: Director Ratifies the Diff before application.

operational_workflow.description: Engineer validates behavior, handling bugs via Debug Loop or rejecting via Rollback.
steps: Enter DEBUG_LOOP if minor failures occur.
operational_workflow.gate: Director reviews findings and [DLR_VFY_AUDIT]; authorizes Phase 5.

operational_workflow.description: Engineer executes automated synchronization and performs a formal Post-Implementation Review.
steps: Execute tools/finalizer.js with version flag and change descriptions.
Execute PIR_V1 to analyze process and outcome producing [DLR_PIR_REVIEW].
Verify automated execution of STAT_V1 ([DLR_STAT_REPORT]), DOC_V1 ([DLR_DOC_README]), and PROTOCOLS synthesis ([DLR_DOC_PROTOCOLS]).

PIR_V1.philosophy: Reflection Drives Mastery: The end of execution is the beginning of analysis.
principles: Transparency over Polish: Debugging history is high-value technical context.
Outcome vs Process: Success is measured by both the product state and the adherence to rules.
Continuous Feedback Loop: Reviews are the primary source of protocol evolution triggers.

review_standard.requirement: Engineer must provide [DLR_PIR_REVIEW]: Success Score, [DLR_VFY_AUDIT], and Debug History.
Engineer must provide a [DLR_PIR_COMPLIANCE] detailing adherence to pulses, snapshots, and gates.
Engineer must identify which protocol step created the most friction and why (Friction Disclosure).
Engineer must provide technical justification for the version shift magnitude.
Mandatory 'Friction Analysis' to justify the procedural pivot.

evidence_standard.requirement: Engineer must provide REASONING and CLAIM for why the implemented logic satisfies the ratified [DLR_GSD_PLAN].

audit_standard.requirement: Verify that all debug loops and logic failures from the cycle are documented in [DLR_PIR_REVIEW].
Perform mandatory verification against the top-level compliance_registry identifiers (CMP_).

operational_workflow.description: Engineer gathers all debug logs and fidelity reports from the current cycle.
steps: Review chat history for Phase 4 Debug Loops.
Perform self-audit of procedural adherence against compliance_registry (Knowledge Pulse, Snapshots).

operational_workflow.description: Engineer presents the [DLR_PIR_REVIEW] to the Director.
steps: Output [DLR_PIR_COMPLIANCE] summarizing adherence to CMP_ constraints.
operational_workflow.gate: Director acknowledges the [DLR_PIR_REVIEW] and authorizes final closure.

DOC_V1.philosophy: Documentation as Code: README.md is a compiled build artifact, not a prose file.
principles: Single Source of Truth: Data resides in JSON sources.
Zero Drift: Manual edits to Markdown artifacts are forbidden.
Total Traceability: All changes propagate through synchronization triggers.

data_standard.requirement: Utilize path_resolver.js for all file pathing.
Ingest [DLR_STAT_REPORT], changelog.json, protocols.json, roadmap.json, and refactor_matrix.json.

synchronization_standard.requirement: Execute node docs/generate_readme.js for ad-hoc updates.

operational_workflow.description: Ensure all JSON authority sources are valid and reachable.
Compile sources into the final [DLR_DOC_README] artifact.
Verify the integrity of the generated Markdown.
steps: Director performs visual audit of Markdown output.

EVO_V1.philosophy: Self-Optimizing Governance: Protocols must adapt to developer friction.
principles: Friction-Driven: Amendments are triggered by identified workflow pain.
Atomic Changes: JSON diffs must be scoped to specific procedural improvements.

data_standard.requirement: Modify tools/protocols.json as the authoritative source.

evolution_standard.requirement: Full system review required when version increments (e.g., v1.x to v2.x).
Review required after 5 consecutive minor amendments (x.5.x).
Evolution triggered by identified bottleneck in the compliance audit.
Review required when protocol schema or data requirements are modified.

approval_standard.requirement: No protocol change without explicit Director approval.
Engineer must execute tools/onboard.js --refresh to synchronize mental model.

operational_workflow.description: Engineer identifies friction and proposes JSON diff to protocols.json.
Engineer provides a clear rationale for the procedural pivot.
The Director approves or rejects the proposed procedural change.

CFG_V1.philosophy: Immutable Base, Dynamic Overlay: Control simulation behavior without touching core logic.
principles: Test Isolation: Each test must have a standalone .js file.
Injectability: Configuration must be passed via CLI arguments.
Reproducibility: Config files must be checked into the repository.

execution_standard.requirement: Components must handle missing properties gracefully.

operational_workflow.description: main.js checks for CLI arguments and resolves the config path.

VAL_V1.philosophy: Heisenbug Hunting: Stability requires iterative verification.
principles: Iterative Stress: Run tests 5x sequentially to expose race conditions.
Resource Accountability: Monitor memory and CPU core distribution.
Zero Regression: No optimization is valid if it breaks thread safety.

verification_standard.metric: Execute target scenario 5x sequentially to expose race conditions.
100% hash parity required across all iterations.
Director monitors RSS memory and CPU core distribution.

operational_workflow.description: Execute the target scenario 5 times.

STAT_V1.philosophy: System Pulse: Real-time visibility into engine health and technical debt.
principles: Telemetry Driven: Status is synthesized from changelog and git state.
Categorical Clarity: Information must be partitioned into Capabilities, Modules, and Debt.
Automation First: status.json is never manually edited.

reporting_standard.requirement: Detect and report Clean/Dirty git state via git --porcelain.

operational_workflow.description: Engineer executes synthesis via node docs/generate_status.js.

OPTIMISE_V1.philosophy: Friction-to-Flow: Structural improvement without operational regression.
principles: SQA Anchored: Every refactor must map to a System Quality Attribute.
Guardrail Priority: Operational performance must be baseline-verified.
Continuous Record: The Refactor Matrix is an immutable history of evolution.

data_standard.requirement: Map changes to System Quality Attributes in attributes.json.
Update refactor_matrix.json via dedicated helper script.

regression_standard.requirement: Any refactor must not regress operational SQAs.

operational_workflow.description: Engineer identifies structural weakness mapped to SQAs in attributes.json.
Execute VAL_V1 to capture 'Before' operational metrics.
Engineer transitions to GSD_V3 loop for implementation.
Execute VAL_V1 to capture 'After' metrics and compare against baseline.
operational_workflow.gate: Director reviews regression report and Ratifies or Approves Rollback.

operational_workflow.description: Update docs/refactor_matrix.json and synchronize via DOC_V1.

ROADMAP_V1.philosophy: Intentional Evolution: Strategic planning is a multi-dimensional analysis of past, present, and future system state.
principles: Evidence-Based: Grounded in current code functionality and technical debt.
Intent-Aligned: Every milestone must serve the core mission of the engine.
SQA-Anchored: Features must be explicitly linked to Quality Attributes.

governance_standard.requirement: Must follow high-verbosity schema in roadmap.json.
Director approval required before injection into library.

operational_workflow.description: Engineer reviews current code status, functionality, purpose, and intent.
Acknowledge evolution from previous versions and project possible future outcomes.
Identify key areas for expansion and improvement (Domains).
Develop specific features anchored on SQAs.
operational_workflow.gate: Director ratifies new items before injection into roadmap.json.

operational_workflow.description: Engineer updates roadmap.json and synchronizes documentation.
